title: Default Credentials (test:test) Enable Authentication Bypass
description: The Trading Platform login application contains a hardcoded test account with credentials test:test that allows complete authentication bypass. These credentials are functional in production and can be used to gain full access to the application. The credentials are even documented in an HTML comment within the login page source code (TODO: Delete the testing account (test:test)), indicating they were intended for development/testing purposes but were never removed before production deployment.
impact: Complete authentication bypass. An attacker can login as the test user (John) with ID 10032 and gain access to all application functionality, including the dashboard and potentially sensitive operations. As this is a trading platform, attackers could potentially conduct unauthorized transactions, access financial data, and compromise the integrity of the entire system.
evidence:
POC Execution Output:
- Command: POST request to /password/test with credentials (username=test&user_id=10032&password=test)
- Response: HTTP 302 FOUND redirects to /dashboard
- Set-Cookie: auth_token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ1c2VybmFtZSI6InRlc3QiLCJ1c2VyX2lkIjoxMDAzMiwidXNlcl90eXBlIjoiY3VzdG9tZXIifQ.ubKxvL3U9FouYhgqbsNNfV7C6iaVCJ83foZ1bq8roEs
- JWT Payload decoded: {"username":"test","user_id":10032,"user_type":"customer"}
- Valid session cookie also provided: session=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjoxMDAzMn0.aQo4yg.cn2mVB0gm19h34onHlpTJuWHM5E
- Application successfully authenticates and redirects authenticated user to dashboard
- No account lockout, no warning, no unusual security measures detected
remediation:
1. IMMEDIATE: Remove the test account from all environments (production, staging, development, backups)
2. Rotate all credentials and invalidate existing JWT tokens
3. Implement a secret management system (HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, etc.) for any development/test credentials
4. Never hardcode credentials in source code or HTML comments
5. Use environment variables or external configuration for sensitive credentials
6. Implement automated secret scanning in CI/CD pipeline to prevent hardcoded credentials
7. Conduct code audit to identify and remove all test accounts from codebase
8. Implement account lockout mechanisms for suspicious login attempts
9. Add comprehensive logging and alerting for authentication events
10. Consider implementing multi-factor authentication (MFA) for enhanced access control
references: CWE-798: Use of Hard-Coded Credentials, CWE-779: Logging of Credentials, OWASP-A07:2021 – Authentication Failures, OWASP-A01:2021 – Broken Access Control
toolCallDescription: Document the critical authentication bypass vulnerability exploiting hardcoded test credentials
